CHEBOYGAN, MI, 49721-2209
RE: License#: CP160201035
Dear Ms. Waldron:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving the license
in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If you move,
please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, Area Manager, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• Technical assistance was not provided at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested of provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period. The agency CAP was submitted in response to those violations
established during the 2023 Interim Inspection. The current renewal inspection did
not establish any violations, indicating the CAP was successful in preventing any
repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was thorough and well written. The
assessment identified barriers such as short staffing, caseworker changes, COVID

19 pandemic, and caseworkers spending substantial time with transportation,
extra parenting time, and uploading documents. The report was also thorough in
addressing disrupted and unplanned removals. The assessment further addressed
CAP compliance and the agency's efforts to maintain compliance.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and financial records were not available for
review.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by their supervisor and that they are a
part of a supportive well functioning team.
Youth were not interviewed by the consultant.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is a local DHHS office and is spacious and well maintained.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst generated three safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They
are as follows.
Safety Alert # 1. The safety alert was generated on April 5, 2023 as a bow as a
sporting bow was found unsecured. The bow was removed from the home and
placed in storage not located on the property. Safety alert resolved.
Safety Alert #2. The home is experiencing some construction and a bedroom does
not have a finished ceiling. Children are now sleeping in a room with no exposed
joists. The door to the bedroom with the unfinished ceiling is closed and children do
not have access. Construction tools are also secured and not available to children
having access to them. A bedroom where a foster child was sleeping had a video
camera capable of viewing and monitoring the room. The camera was removed and
photos provided.
Safety Alert #3, dated May 4, 2023, provided photo documentation that the
construction noted in safety alert #2 was resolved.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.

August 28, 2023
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
